intro: Gagea stenopetala f. exscapa, commonly known as the exscapa form of the narrow-petaled gagea, is a rare and delicate plant belonging to the Amaryllidaceae family. It is characterized by its small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in woodland habitats, preferring moist, well-drained soils. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves that emerge from a bulbous base. This botanical variation is notable for its unique floral structure and limited geographic distribution.
